name: Drury Inn & Suites Riverwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice place - and RIGHT by the Riverwalk! It is in a great old refurbished building and is literally steps from the Riverwalk. The rooms are fairly average except have fabulous high ceilings and great windows as well as great lighting (which is a hotel rarity). Otherwise it is typical "Drury" with well-known great extras. Our contact with staff was minimal, but there were no problems.
reviews.title: So close to the Riverwalk!

reviews.text: The Land and Cattle eatery on the bottom floor of the hotel was a fabulous find - the service was great and the prices were amazing for steaks, etc!
reviews.title: Great Stay-will return again!

likes.liked: — Very Clean, great decor and great location

reviews.text: We were a little disappointed to have no Riverwalk view from our room because that was the reason for choosing this Drury and you could see nothing out of the great windows except a construction zone but that won't be a longterm issue. For those going to visit soon, you might want to keep that in mind though.
reviews.title: Very nice place on the Riverwalk

likes.disliked: — Parking garage is small and parking charge too high.

reviews.text: Also, upon arrival it is important to note that the access to the parking garage is in a little alley type drive right next to the building. They have security persons who will stop you there and then allow you on to the 5-minute parking spots for check-in. (The parking garage is about $14/day.)
reviews.title: Hidden Gem - Drury Inn and Suites Riverwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel because of it's location on the Riverwalk and the great S.A.V.E. rate. Best price on the river that met our family of four needs and expectations. During Christmas season, the river is beautifully decorated with lights and it's a fun get away for the family. Rather than printing the directions from the hotel website, we used mapquest. Be aware that those directions will take you to the wrong side of the hotel. Although the desk people were neutral in their enthusiasm and greetings, the bell hop went over and beyond to help us and make us feel at home. Especially when he realized our frustration of coming to the wrong entrance and having to drive around the block again to go to the right entrance for valet parking. There is a mandatory valet parking fee of 18.00 each night. Was not thrilled about that, but knew going into the reservation that is their policy.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night visit at the Drury Inn & Suites on the Riverwalk. Nice and clean hotel. I am a very fussy traveler who reads all the reviews and wanted to write a review for once! I'm not one to overpay for a hotel room. I like to get a good deal and stay somewhere nice, but I don't like paying alot. The prices of the hotels on the Riverwalk are very high. This was the best hotel for the money that I could find after hours of shopping. My husband and I were very happy with my choice. They have a great breakfast, happy hour with 3 free drinks each night and soda and popcorn each afternoon included in your rate. They also have a pool and hottub for relaxing. I was most impressed with the cleaniness of the city after visiting many ciites. The hotel has lots of security. For me, a bit much. I do like to feel safe, but this was a very nice area.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay!

reviews.text: The location was so convenient on the Riverwalk for walking and going to eat. We didn't get a car and walked everywhere. The Riverwalk is very close even if you're not a walker. We walked up on the streets to the Marketsquare ( 10 mn walk), Tower of the Americas- 10 mn; The Alamo, and the Rivertown Mall. Unless you need to leave the city or have a longer visit, you do not need a car. The cab seemed overpriced; 15 min ride for $26. You can take the city bus for $1.15; but it was annoying with all the stopping. Don't expect top shelf for the happy hour, still ok though and the breakfast was better than most we've had. The staff at the hotel are great!! Very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: We had a King room facing the River. Very nice and comfortable. The bathroom area is a bit crowded, but no biggy. Nice separate sink area.
reviews.title: Better then the Hilton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came with a big group but we were the first ones in our group to check in. We asked for a non-smoking room when we booked and that it was very important because of my childs allergies. They gave us a smoking room down stairs and said that was all that was available even though some of our group didn't check in for 5 hours after us. It smelled awful and the staff was rude. They had no appologies when we asked about this. We will never stay there or recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great bargain

reviews.text: My whole family loved this hotel. We took the kids for Halloween fright fest. The hotel was 20 minutes from Sea World. When I asked the kids if they enjoyed their mini-vacation, they said the best part of the trip was the hotel. Nice pool and hotub. Great veiws from the pool. They have an indoor pool.They have a FREE happy hour and snacks for the kids. FREE hot buffet breakfast! The rooms are recently renovated. VERY nice. We are already planning our next trip there!
reviews.title: Great hotel right on Riverwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We splured a little for my husband's birthday and stayed the Drury on the Riverwalk - so worth it, this hotel was awesome! They asked when we checked in what we were in town for and when we told them to celebrate my hubby's b-day, they said, hmmmmm, let me see what we have available...and then proceeded to give us a free upgrade to room overlooking the Riverwalk for no extra charge!!! We were shocked and so excited! And sure enough when we got to the room we opened up the windows and looked down and there it was! Awesome! We went and checked out the rooftop pool, very cool - and then headed downstairs for the free happy hour - great perk! Then we headed down to the Riverwalk just steps away for the evening. We had a great time exploring the Riverwalk, complete with boat tour of course, and then dinner and bar hopping. The hotel location was unbeatable - and the room with a view was icing on the cake. Great stay!
reviews.title: Awesome - Loved It!

reviews.text: My husband and & I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip for a few days. The hotel is in the middle of downtown, right on the riverwalk.
reviews.title: On riverwalk-Great location

reviews.text: Please be advised that they are doing construction on the hotel right next to it which obstructs the view of the parking garage. When you are driving down St. Mary's you will take a right turn right after the construction fence. Otherwise you will end up circling the blocks to get back.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a family vacation

reviews.text: Our hotel was very large and clean. I only had a few minor problems while staying there. The first was the noise from the construction of the hotel next door. This was during the week so they started about 8am. I think they might start later on the weekends but if I was trying to sleep in I would have been pretty upset.
reviews.title: Texas Friendly!

reviews.text: The other problem was that our smoke detector started beeping every 20 minutes. When I left to explore the riverwalk I spoke to the front desk about it. They immediately sent someone up to my room and fixed it. I was pretty impressed with how quickly they handled it! Other hotels just dismiss me and say they would send up someone when they had a chance.
reviews.title: Avoid Room 610!!!

likes.disliked: — Higher rooms have no view of the Riverwalk.

reviews.text: was the first time we had ever stayed at a drury inn hotel, we were very impressed.We had a wonderful stay..
reviews.title: loved the drurry inn

reviews.text: This hotel was excellent all around! The lobby was gorgeous! Our room was big, the beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. Our room had a fridge and a microwave too. The included hot breakfast was very good. They had a happy hour every evening with 3 free drinks per person.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!!!

reviews.text: The staff was beyond helpful. We had issues with a rental car (do NOT rent from Enterprise, they were norrible) and the hotel staff was incredibly helpful.
reviews.title: not what we expected!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is about a 5 minute walk to the Alamo and a 5 minute walk along the riverwalk to the heart of the restaurants and bars along the riverwalk. It was about 2 minutes to get to restaurants above ground.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay on Riverwalk!

likes.liked: — The proximity to the Riverwalk area, walked to the Alamo, spotlessly clean, quiet.
likes.disliked: — Cant think of anything - really happy with this accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would absolutely stay here again if I go to San Antonio again.
reviews.title: Would stay here again, loved all the extras

likes.liked: — Complementary hot breakfast, happy hour, popcorn and soft drink, Right on the Riverwalk
likes.disliked: — Street level area around the hotel seemed dark and a little unsafe at night.

description: Drury Hotel offers its guests a variety of free extras – take, for example, our free hot breakfast. At Drury, “hot” means scrambled eggs, biscuits & gravy, sausage and make-your-own Belgian waffles. In the evening, join us at our 5:30 Kickback® for free hot food and cold beverages. Our rotating menu features a variety of hot foods, baked potatoes, garden salad, beer, wine, mixed drinks and more! To burn off all of those free extras, Drury has a 24-hour exercise center and a parking lot to jog around. Lastly, Drury’s free wireless Internet and free long distance calls will ensure you can keep tabs on all of your posse back home. Step outside and into the unmatched beauty of the San Antonio River Walk. With countless restaurants and shops within scenic walking distance.
